Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Sealants for Hemostasis in Vascular Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either sealants or standard care controls

Participants.evidence: including 2376 participants undergoing vascular surgery with anastomosis

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either sealants or standard care controls (oxidized cellulose, gelatin sponge, manual compression)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of sealants in achieving anastomotic hemostasis in vascular surgery

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was time to hemostasis, measured intraoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible due to the nature of the intervention

Number_Randomised.evidence: 2376 participants were randomised: 1188 to the sealant group and 1188 to the control group

Result_Outcome.evidence: Sealant use reduced time to hemostasis (mean difference -230.09 seconds, 95% CI -329.24 to -130.94; p < 0.00001)
